thread.title: Amazon to buy video software company, eyeing more video streaming options
thread.title_full: Amazon to buy video software company, eyeing more video streaming options - MarketWatch

author: Claudia Assis
title: Amazon to buy video software company, eyeing more video streaming options
text: Amazon.com Inc. AMZN, -1.14% said Thursday its cloud-services unit Amazon Web Services has agreed to buy Portland, Ore.-based video software company Elemental Technologies Inc. for an undisclosed sum. Elemental's products and Amazon Web Services will provide media and entertainment companies with "solutions to efficiently and economically scale video infrastructures as the media industry increasingly moves to internet based delivery," Amazon said. Software that helps deliver video over the Internet has been in demand as consumers switch to streaming options. Major League Baseball's streaming unit has helped establish HBO's new HBO Now offering and is headed toward a spinoff into its own company, and Turner Broadcasting recently acquired another company in the sector , iStreamPlanet.Amazon's deal with Elemental is expected to close in the fourth quarter.
